Reviews.Title: “Extremely poor attitude from reception staff!!”
Reviews.Author: Rednavillo
Reviews.Content: During a stay at this hotel we received an extremely poor attitude from a quite corpulent man among the reception staff. The staff at the restaurant, the bar and the reservation department were quite friendly and service minded though. This is what happened: When returning to our hotel room we discovered a heavy smell of tobacco smoke in our non-smoking room. Due to the fact that we both have asthma I immediately went downstairs to the reception to ask if we could change room? I came across a quite corpulent man among the reception staff. I explained the situation and the reply that I was given was: "Is it REEEEEALLY that bad??". I did not believe my ears! When I insisted that we were given another room the quite corpulent man gave me a heavy sigh and then handed over a new room key and just looked at me, as if I were a total idiot. The man did not even ask if we needed any assistance when changing room. We have never ever been so unkindly treated at any hotel before! Never ever will we choose the Golden Tulip Berlin Hotel Hamburg again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: jade n
Reviews.Content: A really well located and clean hotel! - Close to the KaDeWe, all the shops, the Zoo/Aquarium and within walking distance to all the historical sights. The breakfasts are great especially the omlet chef! The only downside was the view from the room was of another building. Would definatley stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Superply managed Hotel in berlin”
Reviews.Author: Peter K
Reviews.Content: Again this year my stay at this hotel was truly a superior experience. Aside from the most recent renovation, which turned out extremely well, the attitudes of the staff and management make this my favorite hotel in Europe. Nothing comes closer than to feel at home. Even during ITB , when the hotel is fully occupied everyone on the staff is professional, most accommodating and most of all, very friendly. Bravo, for a job well done!

Reviews.Title: “nice and clean”
Reviews.Author: mubis
Reviews.Content: It is the first time I stayed at this hotel I liked the superior rooms. the hotel is very central and there are nice restaurants around. no Wi-Fi in the rooms. cable internet is available with charge. Breakfast was nice as well. I only can complain about the c/out time. it is 10 am. so early and the way they told us was so impolite.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: MrBrambari
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in this hotel several times on business and find it excellent in every respect and very good value for money. The superior rooms are as advertised, clean, spacious and well heated. The staff are friendly, helpful and professional in their dealings with guests and very responsive to requests and queries. Breakfast is generous and adequate for all tastes, has very good variety and there is a chef in attendance for special orders. The buffet lunch provided for our group was excellent in terms of quality, freshness and quantity. The dining room is pleasant and the service competent and attentive. This high standard has been maintained over the two years that I have been visiting this hotel and there is a genuine interest in maintaining the quality of the srvices provided.

Reviews.Title: “Very good trip to berlin.”
Reviews.Author: sheenaPrestonEngland
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at the hotel. Accommodation was good,comfy bed, quiet and warm room, good cleaning service. I asked for a kettle which came very quickly. We used the internet in the lobby area(free) and were always able to access it.Reception was very helpful, speedy check-in and check-out, rapid response to kettle request and to room change since 1st room's bathroom smelt rather musty. Hotel is on 100 bus route, so handy for most sites and zoo railway station from where we took train to Schonefeld airport, some 30 minutes away. Berlin card a must! There are restaurants round about....we found a very good one along Kurfusten strasse to the left about 5 minutes walk away,a pub/restaurant with excellent German food. The area is quiet at night, so you need to go further afield for clubs and pubs.

Reviews.Title: “Made our trip wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Lisa L
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed this hotel very much. Spacious room for 3, 2 adults and a teenager, had the room all ready when we arrived. Food at the restaurant was fabulous and the waiter even made a dessert table side which was not on the menu. The buffet for breakfast was hearty and had a great combination of eggs and fruits, cheeses, breads. Location to tourist attractions was very convenient and the location of the hotel was very quiet. If we have the opportunity to go back would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Take the good with the bad...”
Reviews.Author: joeb1249
Reviews.Content: What I saw when I first entered my room was quite disappointing, especially after a long and grueling trip. The room was quite small and utilitarian with two single beds and very little storage. There is a sliding door that covers either an area with a tiny shower and toilet or an oddly configured sink in the middle of the room. I felt as if I were staying in a college dormitory room that was furnished from IKEA. The bed was hard and uncomfortable and was covered only with a top sheet that had a duvet folded up at the bottom. I felt that the bed was never properly made, since I had to spread out the comforter every night. Everyday, when the room was made up, the duvet was refolded and placed at the bottom of the bed. Amenities are few and far between, and the design of the room is modular. With a only a small floating shelf to use as a desk, it was uncomfortable when using the work area for any length of time. In addition, I find the rate of 15 Euros per day to be an excessive amount for Internet service. Now to the positive side. After a couple of days at the Golden Tulip, I realized that the staff were friendly and helpful, and it eased the burden of the sparse accommodations. Their attentiveness and courtesy began to win me over and I concentrated less on what was wrong with the hotel. The breakfast buffet, although not included in the room rate, was reasonably priced and pretty good overall. I had dinner at the same restaurant on two occasions, and it provided better than many hotel dinners I have had in the past. The hotel is relatively new and always appeared clean and fresh. The Golden Tulip Berlin would not be my first choice on my next trip to the city, but during a busy convention week, it proved to be adequate. I appreciate the service from the staff and they made my stay more enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel clean and friendly”
Reviews.Author: Hiness
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights during stay in Berlin just a few min walk from the tubes and loads of shops will be going back.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: lotliv
Reviews.Content: the hotel is in a very good location, very close to the 100 bus line, a minuts walk of the KaDaWe and the Kudamm. we visited at Christmas time and we got chocolate and best wishes from the hotel manager. The hotel staff were polite and attentive and helped with any problem that we had. the rooms were nice (we were 5 people in 2 rooms) and clean, but there was no ventilation in the bathroom which required us to leave the door open after use, and the double room was pretty small... the hotel has a bar on it's 11th floor and there's a great view throw the big windows. The only problem was the quality of the breakfast on our last day at the hotel, which was not good, but when we Complained the staff immediately addressed the problems. we'll return..

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a handy location!”
Reviews.Author: MissTrishFace
Reviews.Content: We took a cheap upgrade from our cheapest of cheap rooms of 15 euros a night when we arrived and were thrilled with our amazing room. Whilst not central the hotel was a 2minute walk from Wittenburg Platz station which made it a good combination of convenient but quiet at night. If you stay here tho, we would recommend getting your breakfast at the icecream parlor restaurant on the corner by the station. . . they do an amazing range of traditional German breakfasts and its really lovely! I would recommend this hotel but if getting the train go to Witternburg Platz and go up to the right past the Kaisers shop and then right at the main road and find it from there.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: josh040875
Reviews.Content: Situated close to the zoo, easy to get to the transport network, shops and resteraunts all near by, nice large rooms, only vice is the cost of Internet €24 per day, hotel staff were great, buffet breakfast was normal for the region, would recommend you have the chef make you an omelet

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: guevara
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a business trip. The hotel is really nice, good quality rooms and really friendly staff. I didn't get to see much of the city due to work but the hotel is about 10 minute taxi ride (or 30 minute walk) to the Brandenburg Gate and Reichstag building which are well worth a visit. I will definately go back to see more and I would have no hesitation in staying at the Golden Tulip Hotel Hamburg

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Classy Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: Maressa77
Reviews.Content: We (my husband, sister in law, mother in law and I) stayed at this wonderful hotel 27th - 30th September 2011. Before writing about the hotel we would like to say a huge 'Thank You' to Sebastian who was on reception during our stay. He was was very helpful and welcoming to our family and made our stay extra special :o) The Hotel is well located on a quiet street in the centre of the city close to shops, restaurants, public transport & attractions. There is a gym next door which residents can use. The hotel was very well presented and all areas had a relaxed high quality feel to the decor and layout. The Hotel breakfast was impressive with plenty of choice and daily variations of hot and cold foods. It was easy to find a healthy option if we wanted. There were also a substantial range of teas and juices to choose from. The purpose of our trip was my sister in-law's birthday. I e-mailed ahead to let the hotel know. On arrival Sebastian wished her a happy birthday and informed her that her room had been up-graded. My husband and I were also given a slight upgrade. Now that's what I call great customer service! Rooms were beautiful, modern and kept spotlessly clean. Hotel staff were helpful, approachable, friendly and polite. Even when I flooded the bathroom! This hotel was chosen as an upgrade when our travel agent made a mistake with our original booking, so we did not pay full price. However I think it is well worth the list price. It turned out to be the best mistake made in our favour! We couldn't fault our stay, it was amazing. I would have no hesitation in returning to this hotel. Well Done Golden Tulip (Berlin) !!!

Reviews.Title: “A quiet but central location”
Reviews.Author: luckyLiverpool
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 5 nights..15th-20th august in the Golden Tulip. What a find, excellent location, 30yds from 100 Bus which took you to Alexanderplatz .anor Tiergarten for connections to almost anywhere. and Wittenberger Platz and the UBahn literally a 10 minute walk. So much for location .... The Hotel was definitely 4star The Buffet breakfast was excellent, hot or cold with a big variety of both. TheBeds were probably the most comfortasble we've had in a hotel for a long time..The whole place was spotlessly clean, quiet, decor classy, and polite and friendly staff always willing to be of assistance. All in all an excellent hotel. If we go back to Berlin any time in the near future(we hope) this is the Hotel for us

Reviews.Title: “" I ll be back!"”
Reviews.Author: ioanna c
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel on August 30th for two nights with our 8 year old doughter. This hotel is excellent in every way. Location is the best in Berlin because its close to everything , and also safe.Parking available at cost hotel provided, but also in the side streets.Restaurants within walking distance. Staff very polite and helpfull.Breakfast ... perfect with great variety.Room was great and spacious and elegant. Stayed at the 718 upgraded from std room.If you travel by your car then this is the best choice. Definitely would go back, and of course i will recommend it to my clients,since i am a travel agent.

Reviews.Title: “This was my Second Stay at Tulip and looking forward to my third stay!”
Reviews.Author: HadrianIMP
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Tulip on a Business conference in March 2011 and was impressed enough to return in July with my two children, The Hotel is an excellent value, well located, large, modern and clean. We had a superior room with Sofa bed and which was a very good size for the 3 of us. The room has a large flat scree TV (Mostly German TV) and large bathroom with walk in shower. The Breakfast buffet was great and the service excellent. The hotel is steps away from the #100 Bus, 200-300 meters to a U Bahn stop ,and 10-15 min Walk to Zoo-Kurfürstendamm so very centrally located. Berlin is a place to visit, clean, and dynamic and the Tulip is a great place to stay in comfort while exploring Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, Awesome location”
Reviews.Author: GeshaZ
Reviews.Content: Good hotel, liked it very much. Since we were at off-peak season, our room was upgraded to a luxury suit for only 15 euros per night. Great breakfast, clean rooms. Good location - only 10 minutes from underground, zoo, train and shopping area. Some nice restaurants nearby. I do recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “berlin 2011”
Reviews.Author: alelove3
Reviews.Content: spend good time in berlin, first time for me, but i would like to go there again, maybe not for business...........like holiday! Anyway, the hotel is ok.... Position: 5 min. by walk from kudamm, the commercial street in berlin.....u find there all that u need and want! desk point: great people, speack in english, like most of german person room:ok, not to big, but clean and no noise, so u can sleep!there is moquette, pesonally i son't like, but was clean breakfast.ok, u find sweet ans salty paypark for car and rent a bike, cost is aroun 12 euro for 1 day i m not sure, but i haven't seen the gym enjoy your trip! Alex

Reviews.Title: “no value for its money!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: tidus1453
Reviews.Content: The hotel is near to center of the city but it is not worth the money. We arrived at the hotel exhausted from the trip and we found out that we had twin bed instead double that we had booked. The room except the bathroom was very small. Also the bar on the top floor that is advertised and it was a plus for our reservation was closed. The receptionists were not helpful with us, not even to call a taxi. We were calling from our cellphones.The internet was with payment in the 21th century!!!! A total mess!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “confortable hotel with good service”
Reviews.Author: jkhammer68
Reviews.Content: Located at quiet street with 500 meters to Kadewa. Very good service and excelent breakfast. We had superior room which was very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel in Quiet Location - Short walk from Centre”
Reviews.Author: Retired_55plus
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights at the hotel as part of a large group. Check in was well organised and though the standard double rooms were compact, they were very clean and all the facilities needed. The hotel can provide a kettle, tea/coffee if you ask. Personally I would prefer to be slightly outside the cente in a quiet street. You can open the bedroom window without traffic noise all night. Great breakfast, too much to eat. If you want an expensive central, in a noise area, then do not choose this hotel. Otherwise if you want a good quality, clean, quiet hotel near the centre then I would recomend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: italian_traveller73
Reviews.Content: We had the chance to stay at this 4 star hotel at the same price of a 2 start: nice location ( not closed to the underground but the n. 100 bus is just out of the door), in 15 minutes you can arrive at Alexander platz. The breakfast was excellent, good service. The rooms were a little bit small but well equipped. I would recommend this hotel expecially if you can book a special offer!

Reviews.Title: “NY2010”
Reviews.Author: Bertie525 Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: Apart from the 2 female receptionist at check in who were not very welcoming we had a very pleasant stay over the NY period. Rooms were large, modern and welcoming. Resteraunt on ground floor was being refurbished however 11th floor breakfast room/bar was good substitute with excellent views and food. Location is a bonus with Ka de Ve and U-Bhan a 5 minute walk. Would use again.

Reviews.Title: “With so many options in Berlin, stay elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: werbeelf
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel on an offer, which included two nights and some extras, including a meal, and despite the relatively good price of the offer, I was quite disappointed with the hotel. The neighborhood is ok, but it's not very central in terms of public transportation. The restaurant options in the area are also quite limited. The general impression of the hotel is indeed a 60s building that is still in process of being restored to look somewhat modern. The bathrooms are quite nice in the mean time, and the rooms themselves have obviously been refreshed and are ok, but the windows are still metal framed, letting in lots of cold air and noise from the outside. There was a weird smell in the lobby and in the room, that I was only able to get out of the room after lots of airing. Personal was not unpleasant, but they were also not friendly. The restaurant's food was equally mediocre. However the breakfast buffet was quite nice and offered a wide variety. It was just all in all a very mediocre stay, and I cannot recommend it, particularly at their regular rates. There are so many great places in Berlin - it really doesn't have to be this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Try telephoning to the USA: an ugly surprise awaits you.”
Reviews.Author: simonebianco
Reviews.Content: I made two telephone calls to the USA using my MCI card through an 800 number and via an American operator, naturally supposing that they would be charged to my home phone, as had always happened in the past. Imagine my surprise when I was charged 30 Euros for the calls. Objections to this charge elicited the following response from the manager: "Too bad - that's just the way it is here." I won't be going back to this hotel. Anne Schulz, Providence, R. I.

Reviews.Title: “good business hotel - but in mixed location”
Reviews.Author: drhenry
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, efficient check-in, breakfast was good (and for about 10 EUR very good value). I always try to eat in the hotel, but their top-floor restaurant was closed, so I went to the Italian across the road which was superb. At Berlin Airport, a helpful guy from the public transport company gave excellent directions, but from the bus stop to the hotel, I ended up walking past some very interesting stretches of the Kurfurstendamm - I kept in mind that if that kind of professions can walk safely, I could do so as well. The actual final 200 yards or so to the hotel were good, with leafy avenues etc.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly adequate - but could do better”
Reviews.Author: BillLondon2010
Reviews.Content: Fairly standard 3-4* fare in the cluster of hotels near the Zoological Gardens and Europa Centre. However, although there were no major issues, a pattern emerged that multiple members of staff seemed flustered if asked to deal with trivial problems of any sort (e.g. glitch with TV, leaky shower, queries with bill). So although you will be unlikely to have any major regrets in choosing this hotel, there are plenty of other options nearby too ...

Reviews.Title: “Unpretensiously comfortable hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: meirionydd
Reviews.Content: There were several copies of 'The Guardian' in the lounge every morning in time for breakfast. The first time I've ever encountered it. Wonderful. Top marks. Breakfast was very acceptable too. Good choice, nicely presented. This is a decent, comfortable, rather understated hotel with good access to Berlin's excellent public transport and, hence, almost anywhere you'd want to go. We did pay extra for a spacious, well-furnished Executive Room which was fine. Staff were polite and helpful though I was surprised in a state of undress by an over-enthusiastic chamber maid!

Reviews.Title: “Just wonderful and faultless”
Reviews.Author: wolfreton
Reviews.Content: We are 4 friends who travel to Germany regularly simply because we know that Germany and Berlin in particular are great places to holiday. Anyone thinking of staying here just book it there is no risk...rooms are immaculate I have never seen whiter lovelier towels. Staff are exellent breakfast is just wonderful. If I thought for a week I could not think of anything to say bad. Well done The Golden Tulip Hamburg Berlin WE WILL BE BACK

Reviews.Title: “Affordable option and not too far from the stations”
Reviews.Author: Pinkybee
Reviews.Content: The rooms are cosy and warm, which was great as it was rather cold at that time of the year. Good breakfast buffet. Close walking distance to the Zoologischer Garten Station and there was a small supermarket near the corner too which was handy. internet access on the old PCs in th3e 'business centre' was extremely slow and extremely expensive, was something crazy like 4 euro for lless than 10mins. Our poor AUD and NZD wasn't very strong at the time so wasn't a pleasant surprise at checkout We found it strange that the cleaning staff (or 'hotel mum") would make our beds and fold our PJs but not empty the overflowing bin at all over the course of our 3N/4D stay. But a big thanks for folding and tucking our jim jams under our pillows daily-thanks hotel mum :)

Reviews.Title: “Good luxurious hotel”
Reviews.Author: Durgavijay
Reviews.Content: Overall clean and quiet hotel with major amenities. Good for business visits too. Variety of food and hygenic healthy stuff. Some of the dishes were nice and it showed that they care international travellers and tastes also!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: Jarbucks
Reviews.Content: Just visited from 15th May to 18th May for a weeken break. Found the Hotel Staff to be extremely attentive and helpful. Continental Breakfast was very good. Rooms were very clean and comfortable. Beds were also very comfy. Hotel is situated about 5 minutes walk from Wittenburg Underground Station which gives easy access to all underground and overground transport. Berlin tour buses stop just around the corner. next time we go to Berlin we'll be staying at the Golden Tulip !!

Reviews.Title: “Wow amazing”
Reviews.Author: Asteroidea
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel from Australia, at just over $100 AU a night and it was amazing. We stayed in a superior room including breakfast. The room was like a mini apartment with king size bed, huge bathroom, separate loung and study desk. The beakfast buffet was very great. The hotel was located near the Europa Centre and Zoo within walking distance. The hop on hop off sightseeing bus was just around the corner. So very good location. It was only a 10 Euro taxi fare to the main railway station for connections with a Eurrail pass.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel for ITB”
Reviews.Author: scarletfever79
Reviews.Content: Stayed here during a large convention.All was very good ,would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: AlexG75
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in this hotel for 3 nights. The hotel is situated near bus stop wich takes you to every importent turist site in few minutes (the public transportaion is very good in Berlin). The rooms are very comfortable and big. The meals are very good. The staff is friendly and polite. Very good hotle, highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money with nice italian restaurant nearby”
Reviews.Author: MosEkaterina
Reviews.Content: The hotel is nicely located (5 minutes walk from KaDeWe) and overall makes very good impression in relation to value for money (I paid 140 EUR for 2 nights stay).

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable apartment”
Reviews.Author: IanAberdeen
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a few days, upgraded to one of their modern, well equipped apartments, about 50m. along the street. It was cool walking to the main building for breakfast on a January morning, but otherwise a very comfortable place to stay. The hotel restaurant was Ok for lunch or dinner, and not overpriced. Good restaurants nearby. The no. 100 bus runs from just across the road to the Museum Insel in about 10 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Very good Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: ausgarium
Reviews.Content: Loved it. Friendly and very professional. West Berlin near the city centre and subway.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it! Well looked after.”
Reviews.Author: contentas
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 3 night stay here. We were upgraded on arrival so our room on the 8th floor was very large and spacious. Everything was brand new and spotless. My lovely husband had planned a special suprise anniversary present for me and the hotel were excellent accomplices and my hubby send the communication and care from staff was first class. Aside from that, breakfast was lovely. Excellent choice. You had to pay extra for a nice coffee (€2.50ish) if you didn't want the filter coffee on offer. There is a big roaring fire in the sitting area. The small bar there is snug and has little booths. Location wise, it is about 12 minutes walk to the KaDeWe and the main shopping area there and the Ubahn (metro) and the main departure point for all the city tour buses (we got the BBS which I DO NOT reccomend - few working head phones and we bought the cruise combined ticket but they issued us the wrond ones and wouldn't help fix the problem the next day, grrrr!) A bus passes near the hotel which goes to Alexander Platz. The zoo is 5 minutes away.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: joedoe2009
Reviews.Content: Good value for money, 3nights ~186€ inc breakfest(1800 hotels.com). Supposed to be a superior room , but find it quite small :( Free safe, good breakfest and very helpful staff. Location ok, a few blocks to nearest underground station and bus stop ~100 meters.

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievably disappointing hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tripperi88
Reviews.Content: First of all, the room wasn't superior even though we booked one. The public areas in the hotel look ok, but the room's don't. The room was unbelievably small, and there was no chance of getting two seperate beds even though we wished for them. The bathroom seemed quite nice at first with its' quite modern sink, but once we got the hang of things, it was horrible. The hairdryer doesn't work at all, the bottom opening thing of the sink doesn't move up or down despite trying to push/pull/move its' tap thing. In other words you can't close or open the water drain, so the water would stay in the sink. You have to pull the part out of the drain and unscrew the little bolt at the end to make it stand higher in order to let the water out of the sink, or screw it closer to make it hang in the drain keeping the water in the sink. So it didn't work. The shower has no curtain, only a window sort of thing about a meter long with a hinge, which is supposed to stay closed by it's rubber bottom not letting the water leak to the other side of the window on to the floor. Well once it got wet, it didn't stay closed and the water flooded on the floor. We wanted and booked a room with air conditioning, but suprise suprise, it didn't work. No matter how you move the two switches, it doesn't work. We noticed the front desk about it, they were shocked and luckily went to fix it in the room. The room got "cleaned" every morning if you wanted, but the sheets were not changed every second day, as told in the room's brochure. The breakfast wasn't anything special, bread, cerial and fruit mostly. I wouldn't reccomend this hotel, it was quite unsatisfactory in many ways noting the fact that we wanted simply working room, which didn't have to be special.

Reviews.Title: “What a great place”
Reviews.Author: Tummyman82
Reviews.Content: We were generously upgraded (no charge) to one of their two new apartment homes because we had a lengthy stay. We were blown away by the decor and overall style of the apartment home - we felt as if we were home. It was our style to the last detail. After a full day of traveling and sight-seeing, it was so nice to come back to a "home"

Reviews.Title: “Not even close to a 4 star hotel!”
Reviews.Author: fanouli
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a trip to Berlin, where I stayed in this hotel. Where should I begin?The rooms are like cages, really tiny, you feel claustrophobia and you cannot move when 2 people are staying in the room. There aren't any double beds, but only twin beds one next to another, although these rooms are classified as double. The personel is rude and not polite at all, except for some exceptions. The breakfast is not suited not even for a 3 star hotel. It had only the essentials and when something was finished, they didn't replace it, although I asked them several times. For example one day they didn't have white bread and omelette and although there was still remaining an hour till the end of breakfast nothing was refilled. Supposedly the hotel offers a common laptop in the lobby, but it was always occupied and when I asked it one day for an emergency from another guest, the receptionist came and told me in an ugly way to leave it. She spoke to me to German, although I told her that I knew only a little. Of course the real reason was that the other customer was German and I a foreigner. So she thought that I could accept this inappropriate behavior. I asked several times for the manager but she wouldn't call him and I don't even know if there was one at the hotel at that time. I've stayed in many 4-star hotels in the past and this could hardly be a 3-star hotel. The only good thing is its location, but there are plenty of other hotels nearby, like the Holiday Inn. I certainly reccomend to search for another hotel, as Berlin offers cheap accomodation in general.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable”
Reviews.Author: tureluur
Reviews.Content: The Golden Tulip Hamburg is situated in a residential area, on a quiet sideroad of the Kurfürstenstrasse in the western part of Berlin. The buses 100 and 200 to the centre of the city (Mitte) have a stop very near the hotel. Walking to the busy Kurfürstendamm and the KaDeWe departmentstore take a 15 minute walk. We were happy with the situation of the hotel but on the other hand we discovered that the more interesting part of Berlin is in the former East-Berlin, the Mitte district (Unter der Linden boulevard, Brandenburger Tor, Reichstag, Spree river etc), which means that a possible next time we will choose a hotel more close to this much nicer part of the city, where history is more present. About the hotel itself: we already were warned in other comments that the standard rooms are quite small and indeed, they truly are! In our opinion this is not what a 4-star hotel should offer to it's guests. The bathroom, too, is small. Every comfort is present, but there definitely should have been more space and a nice chair to sit and relax. A bit budget-class. The breakfast was O.K. but I suppose not better or worse than in other similar hotels in this category. For dinner we would give the advice to look elsewhere. The taste of the food was below expectation and the service was in line with that. The Italian restaurant on the other side of the street offered a very nice meal, but if you like Italian food you definitely should try the Bocca di Bacco restaurant in the Friedrichstrasse 167, opposite the Galeries Lafayette departmentstore in the Mitte district. Summarizing: beautiful city, especially the former East-Berlin part, hotel too expensive for what it offers. Dick and Maaike Gorter The Netherlands

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bigshotbob
Reviews.Content: Visited and stayed at this a hotel for a week.Everything was fine,except the rooms are small.Clean,good internet and very friendly helpful staff.The breakfast buffet is creative and extremely appealing.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Great Location !”
Reviews.Author: sberggren
Reviews.Content: Great hotel with great customer service, would stay again. Take the 100 or the 200 bus line (right outside the hotel on Schillstrasse) and see the city. Quiet, clean, elavator, good food (albeit expensive for the breakfast 14€)

Reviews.Title: “Leave the suitcase at home or get a suite!”
Reviews.Author: Thislife
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hotel Hamburg (Golden Tulip) for a week at the end of Jan. We experienced three different room types. Standard rooms on the lower floors are nicely appointed with modern decor but very cramped in our opinion. Beware that there is not enough room for a normal suitcase at the bottom of the bed. The wardrobe is also a small half size open plan type. As we felt we'd feel claustrophobic after more than one night we upgraded to a comfort room, which are at the end of the corridors and was slightly larger but still small. On the second night we upgraded to a suite on the eighth floor. The room was larger and a similar size to what is usually found at 4* hotels. However these rooms are pre-refurbishment and was darkly decorated with a tiny very old nokia TV, old beds, and lacking safe. Nice views however. There were minor faults in all rooms, eg broken shower enclosures, loose toilet seats etc. We realised the suite window was faulty as there was a small gap in the frame which meant a lot of noise from the street came in. This was put right the next day. There were cigarrete smoke smells in some rooms and along corridors despite them being non-smoking rooms. There is a single pc with free internet access in the business closet next to reception. Breakfast is quite expensive and not great, consequently there were never more than one or two people there each day. There is a mini supermarket right next door and cafes where a decent breakfast costs under 7 euros nearby. The hotel is more like a 20 min fast walk to Wittenberg Platz U bahn, and 25-30 min fast walk to Zoologischer Garten U/S bahn station. To get the famous no. 100 bus to the centre, turn left at the hotel entance , walk to the end of the road and cross the dual carriageway to the other side. The hotel itself is a 1970's style concrete block with modern cladding and small old lifts, and similar style 3 star hotels in the vicinity. It is in a quiet residential area, and nothing of much interest in the evenings in the immediate vicinity, but the KuDamm is 30 mins brisk walk away. We felt fairly safe in this part of West Berlin. Hotel staff were not friendly, or welcoming but efficient. We had to request tea/coffee making facilities which comes with powdered milk and decaff coffee only. This was only ever replenished when requested at reception and not when we asked the room cleaners. Check-out is also 11am and not 2pm as stated in certain booking websites. We would stay here again if we had to but next time we will either pay more and stay in the lively Potzdamer Platz, or City centre part of the Mitte district, or pay less staying in one of the 3* hotels near the Hotel Hamburg (which had larger rooms).

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: pamIreland
Reviews.Content: stayed at the above hotel for 3 nights,staff at reception very friendly and helpful on arrival,rooms spotless,great location,staff very helpful with booking sight seeing trips for us,lovely breakfast,overall very pleased with hotel

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel with excellent service”
Reviews.Author: MCAllerød
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights and enjoyed it very much. Rooms are very clean, standard rooms are a bit small but very modern and well made. Larger rooms on the 10th floor have a wonderful view. Staff is very helpful. We will come back. The bus 100 stops right at the corner of the street.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel Indeed”
Reviews.Author: Aerosmithfan
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very conveniently situated for the Underground and Overground trains, and walkable to various interesting locations. I found the staff to be extremely helpful. The breakfast is so good that you'll be tempted to eat a whole day's calories in about 15 minutes! Rooms have very pleasing modern furnishings, and the bathroom is fab. There's a supermarket very local, don't drink from the mini-bar (even though it's not particularly expensive). I recommend going to the Bauhaus Archive Museum, walking distance from the hotel, and free entry on Saturdays.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and very friendly”
Reviews.Author: MrsKCork
Reviews.Content: The Golden Tulip is a lovely hotel with very pleasant staff. We arrived early in the morning and were able to check into our rooms which was great. We had booked a Comfort room and it was just that. - a large room with big bathroom. There is a nice foyer area with fire and small bar where you can sit and enjoy a few scoops! The Italian restaurant across the road is lovely but a little pricey I thought compared to what you pay in other restaurants (eg the Argentinean Restaurant up the road - great meal = 2 main course + 4 drinks for €35 in total...) If you are flying in to Schoenefeld Airport I would suggest taking the express train from airport to Zoolischer Garten station and then take a taxi from there which would only be about 5euro. We where there for a week and got the weekly travel ticket which is 25.40E but lets you on the train, trams, tube and buses. Overall a great trip and a lovely hotel in a great location and I would return there again no problem.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: StapletonSteve
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hamburg for 3 nights in April 2007. Very pleased with everything. Excellent buffet breakfast with hot and cold selections and plenty of choice. Lobby and restaurant smart and a small bar that was very reasonably priced for a hotel. I booked a superior twin room for not much extra cost and it was a good size with all the usual facilities. Room and bathroom very clean and smart. Beds comfortable and most importantly, nice and quiet. No noise from other rooms, no noise from air conditioning or bathroom fans and even being on the front the noise from the road was minimal. All of the staff from reception to waiters/ waitresses and maids were friendly and helpful. Hotel is in a quiet area but 5 minutes from the underground and bus stops and there are plenty of restaurants on the doorstep. If I go to Berlin again I would have no hesitation in booking this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel.”
Reviews.Author: ttIreland
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a few very pleasant days in Berlin. A great city with so much to see and do. Make sure to visit "The Story oF Berlin " museum, very wothwhile. Jewish Museum interesting but almost too much detail and information in it. The lower ground floor intersting. Great shops, make sure to take a trip to KA Da We which is very close to the Golden Tulip. The food halls are amazing. A little pricey but worth it for the experience. The Golden Tulip is a lovely hotel with very pleasant staff. We arrived early in the morning and were able to check into our rooms which was great. Ask for non-smoking room if you wish. We had a large room with big bathroom, although there was no bath but a good big shower. Not sure if some twin rooms have bath, request it if you want as your feet get tired walking around the city! The breakfasts are great, everything you could possibly ask for. We ate one night in the restaurant which was fine. Nice foyer area with fire and small pleasant bar where you can sit and enjoy cocktails! The Italian restaurant across the road is a little pricey I thought ,and the waiter took it upon himself not to retrun the change but keep as a tip which I didn't like. A little cheeky If you are staying in the hotel I would sugest taking the express train from airport to Zoolischer GArten station and then take a taxi from there which would only be about 5euro. A taxi to the airport cost us just over 30 euro. The hotel has a great location and I would return there again no problem.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel, spotlessly clean.”
Reviews.Author: BOXtheFOX
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel in early December. We upgraded to a comfort room that offered tea and coffee making facilities. What a great hotel in a great location. Huge room with two windows that opened so you could let in some fresh air. Spotlessly clean, good breakfast. My only gripe was that our room had a shower rather than a bath. You can get the number 100 bus almost outside the door that for €2 will take you to the Brandenburg Gate and Reichstag area. The hotel is within easy walking distance of the KaDeWa department store. Have a look at the food hall on the 5th floor and dine in one of its many specialty restaurants or go on up to the 6th floor and eat in the huge atrium area. We enjoyed the Christmas markets. This hotel was just great.

Reviews.Title: “A great and welcome surprise”
Reviews.Author: tapbyrne
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel as part of an Aer Lingus deal and hoped it would be ok for the four nights booked. Well i8t was terrific and exceeded all our expectations . lovely room and excellent breakfast led us to use the hotel restuarant for threeof our four nights stay and it was very good with a some what limited menu but a waiter who was excellent. Bar also very good and good prices with great service . all in all a smashing hotel and we'll be back

Reviews.Title: “super location and value, but ill designed sink faucet and drain”
Reviews.Author: CintiKid
Reviews.Content: My wife and I visited Berlin for 6 nights to see sights and meet friends and scout the place out. For location, the Golden Tulip Hamburg was tops, right on the every-five-minutes bus #100 route. And much wonderful was within easy walking distance as well including the KeDeWe amazing department store.The restaurant across the street, Sorriso, was superb in food, service, and friendliness. Room nice, but the faucet of the sink was very problematic - splashed us every time we tried to turn from cold water to warm; and the drain had so narrow an opening as to be difficult to use. And that's an important thing in a hotel. The included breakfast was excellent, but charged significant euros extra for decaffeinated coffee -- we could not believe that. The front desk folks were a bit curt and unhelpful in general. I bumped my shin on a black elevation of the public sitting room fireplace - it was really difficult to see. But if you don't mind an ill-designed sink, the location is so good that we recommend the Golden Tulip anyhow

Reviews.Title: “BRILL BERLIN HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: deirdb
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel in September . We were delighted with the hotel, the rooms were a good size but the lobby and dining rooms were huge. The lobby had several large sofas and chairs and there was a choice of smoking and non smoking dining rooms. Breakfast was a coice of hot or cold buffet food and there was a wide choice to suit everyones taste. Striaght across from the hotel is an excellent Italian Restaurant and Joe's Beer Garden beside the Zoological Gardens Train station is brill and good value. The steaks are wonderful. This hotel has a local bus stop round the corner and is a 5 minute walk to the main shopping area. Plan to return again next year

Reviews.Title: “Find somewhere else!”
Reviews.Author: impavidus
Reviews.Content: The Golden Tulip Hamburg hotel is one of those establishments where the concept of hospitality got lost along the way some years ago, never to be found again. Ever since the hospitality genie turned his back on these premises, staff have been trying to make do with various other less helpful spirits, borrowing heavily from those less pleasant, but much more tenacious, genies that normally lurk in the corridors of public sector administration. Its location isn’t bad, off a main road and therefore quiet and only about 10’ walk from the KDW, the best (and most expensive) department store in Berlin. The area around the hotel is OK; though there are a couple of ‘adult’ shops which you will see on the way to the main shopping precinct (I say this in case you are offended by these establishments). Your experience as a guest, as ever, starts at reception. I was greeted in a very efficient and mildly patronising way while I was handed over the key, when very strict instructions on where and when breakfast was served were literally shouted at me. I know that with tens of thousand of air miles behind me and being in my mid forties my hearing isn’t what it used to be, but this was the first time ever that I was loudly ‘instructed’ about breakfast, rather than simply told. After this teenager finished shouting his orders, he asked in the same tone of voice whether I had further questions, so, rather than risking it, I decided instead to meekly take leave of reception, quickly sneaking into the lift. I was told I had been allocated a newly refurbished room, which at first sight looked great; soft colours greeted you and invited you in, so I did, and here is when problems started. I wanted somewhere to drop my case; but the designers had obviously not foreseen the possibility that people staying in a hotel could carry a case, so there was either the small armchair, or the floor. I opened the (tiny) wardrobe, found the safe, tried re-setting it and got an error message; reported it to reception later (by then staffed by an equally unhelpful person), and was thanked for reporting it. Pardon me, what are you going to do about it? Sorry, no one around to fix it, maybe tomorrow… well, no use to me, as I was only staying one night. It was unusually warm in Berlin and I had a busy day, I was hot and bothered and wanted, literally, to chill out while catching up with some work. I switched the air con controls, put it on full blast and the unit started blowing air, and that was that. I mean ‘air’, but nothing of the ‘conditioning’ element. A further call to reception enlightened me on the fact that air-con could only be switched on during ‘certain months of the year’ (January and February maybe), scolding me a bit for having dared asking such a silly question. By then, resigned on my fate, I took my laptop out of its case and looked for some work space. The small desk (you may have gathered by now that everything in the room was doll-size and note I am only 5’6”!) was covered in clutter, a basket with a delicious sample of crisps (off the minibar), a tray with additional minibar samples, a large display with hotel brochures – all staff that ended up on the floor as there was no other desk space available and even what this clutter was taken away there was then only space for a small book next to my laptop. Anyway, I could enlighten you about other aspects of my stay, telling you about the bathroom, the bed side lights that when switched on in the middle of the night daze you like car lights or cauterize your fingers when you try to switch them off and so on, why bother? If I were you, unless you suffered from an unhealthy guilt complex and felt like punishing yourself (bosses don’t read this!) I wouldn’t bother with this place, staying instead somewhere where you’d be made feel welcome and where rooms were designed with the most basic travellers’ needs in mind.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Poor Location for Tourists”
Reviews.Author: von_levi
Reviews.Content: The only problem with the hotel is the location. As a healthy 20-something, it took me 30 minutes to walk to the Brandenburg Gate; Museum Island is about 20 minutes further. So plan on taking public transportation or taxis to get too and from the hotel. At night the area is low lit and a bit shady (I decided to walk back after a concert at the Philharmonie). I got the impression that most of the people staying at hotel were businessmen who would have their taxi rides comped and tour groups who had their own buses. The hotel itself is fairly modern. My single room was a good size. The breakfast was quite good. The hotel restaurant was fair at best, though, I appreciated the convenience of having a restaurant on site. The staff was terrific. If it were not for the location, I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great inexpensive hotel in the center of West Berlin”
Reviews.Author: grandmonsterb
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Golden Tulip Hamburg Hotel from November 24th to November 28, 2005. From NYC to Berlin-back to NYB: via Delta, direct flights to Tegel airport. Overall impression: Very good quality hotel in the quiet area of West Berlin. Location: The hotel is situated on the quite street near the idyllic Tiergarten-park (diplomatic district). The hotel in only 5-6 city blocks away (15 minutes of fast walking) from the main shopping area Kurfurstendamm ('Europe' shopping center, KaDeWe department store, P&C, C&A, H&M department stores) and U-ban subway station. Transportation to/from airport: Taxi from the airport: 15-20 minutes, about 17 euros. There is also 'TXL' bus available that runs from the airport to the U-ban station not too far away from the hotel. Transportation from the hotel to points of interest: The bus stop(#100) is half a block from the hotel entrance. This route goes all the way to the center of the city (Potsdam Platz, Alexanderplatz, Berlin Dome, Checkpoint Charlie, Reichstag, Brandenburg Gate, TV tower Buy a day ticket (Tageskarte) at any U-ban/S-ban station for about 5.60 euros - covers traveling via any bus/tram/train/subway within zones A and B - the entire city center and surrounding areas. Taxi from the hotel to KaDeWe store area is about 5 euro, takes 5 minutes. Hotel: The hotel is a pretty modern building with about 150 rooms and a view on the quiet side street. Check in: we've arrived about 10:30 in the morning and the room was available at 11:00AM (even thought the official check-in time is at 2PM). All staff speaks English. Room: very large per European standards, included two single beds, a round table with two chairs, in-wall closet, refrigerator (fee for the drinks), two windows, carpet(in pretty good condition), decent size bathroom with a shower (no bath)and hair dryer, great water pressure, shampoo was provided. Radio, Cable-TV: small..about 17 inches TV with 40 channels(37 German Channels, one French and two English- CNN and BBC). No room safe, A/c, you can regulate the room temperature in the room during heating season as well as during summer. Service: room was cleaned pretty good everyday, towels should be left on the floor in the bathroom otherwise they would not be replaced. Room service: regular choice of sandwiches and few hot dishes (pasta, pizza, soup - prices about 7 euros for the soup and 7-10 euros for the main courses) Food: buffet breakfast (6:30-11:00AM) was included in the room rates ($104 per night via Expedia). Food choices: several varieties of hams/sausages/cheeses, smoke salmon and herring, scrambled eggs, sausages and bacon, boiled eggs. Yogurts, canned fruits, fresh fruits(apples, pears, grapes, bananas), pastries, coffee/tea, jams, great breads and even better butter, orange/tomato/grapefruit juices. The restaurant is not very big but contains both smoking and non-smoking areas. Quality of food from great to average depending on your taste. Not very crowded. The restaurant also serves dinner - although I have not tried it during my stay. There is also a small "hanse- bar" that offers fresh draft beer and international drinks. Surrounding area: Several restaurants (Argentinean Steak House, Chinese place, Tai place, few German places couple of blocks away). West Berlin Zoo and Aquarium - 15 minutes walk. Railway station(Zoo Garten Bahnhof) is also about 20 minutes away(fast walk). Check out(11AM): Fast, no extra charges, provided taxi upon request. Cancellation policy: 24 hours or earlier before the day of arrival - no penalty; less than 24 hours - 1 night charge. Who stays in the hotel: 'Business people', families, groups from England, Germany, France.

HotelInfo.Name: Golden Tulip Berlin - Hotel Hamburg
HotelInfo.Address: Landgrafenstrasse 4 | Tiergarten, 10787 Berlin, Germany
